Ruby / Roda - Web Framework / Plugins / AllVerbs

Introduction

The all_verbs plugin adds methods for http verbs other than #.get and #.post.

The following verbs are added, assuming Rack handles them:

  • delete
  • head
  • options
  • link
  • patch
  • put
  • trace
  • unlink

These methods operate just like Roda's default #.get and #.post methods, so using them without any arguments just checks for the request method, while using them with any arguments also checks that the arguments match the full path.

Example

plugin :all_verbs

route do |r|
  
  r.delete do
    # Handle DELETE request
  end
  
  r.head do
    # Handle HEAD request
  end

  r.link do
    # Handle LINK request
  end

  r.patch do
    # Handle PATCH request
  end
  
  r.put do
    # Handle PUT request
  end
  
  r.options do
    # Handle OPTIONS request
  end
  
  r.trace do
    # Handle TRACE
  end
  
  r.unlink do
    # Handle UNLINK request
  end
  
end

The verb methods are defined via meta-programming, so there isn't documentation for the individual methods created.
